title: Valentino Rossi The Game
summary: A videogame entirely dedicated to the career of Valentino Rossi, the 9 time World Champion. Experience the career of Valentino from his perspective in a series of 20 challenges from his first race in 1996 up to 2015. Jump into a new career starting at the VR|46 Academy and taking you up to World Champion. During the championship, Valentino will ask you to take part in different events like drifting, flat, R1M-only races, and rally in order to improve his abilities.
reviews: Valentino Rossi The Game marks a significant leap forward for Milestone s.r.l, it has created an excellent MotoGP experience, managing to capture the career of biking legend. This is a must buy for fans of The Doctor, and anyone that likes bikes!

Valentino Rossi The Game is the best videogame by Milestone so far, full of things to do and a good physical engine under the hood. Some issues still need to be fixed, but the overall vision (from the previous MotoGP games) is preserved, and even enhanced. Give it a chance.
A competent take on MotoGP-series. The Rossi-themed new events are fun. Audiovisual aspects are a bit bland and the multiplayer is already pretty much dead at this point. [Sept 2016]
The complete package for every Moto GP fan, even if there's still some (minor) room for improvement.

Valentino Rossi is a living legend. Milestone named their next MotoGP game after him and oh my... What a good game. This is very promising for future games to come. Rossi is already a legend, but this game might just become a legend too.
Appealing and a very complete racing experience. A bit tough around the edges in some areas, but a great effort nonetheless.
Valentino Rossi: The Game may be too much of an advert for the motorcycle legend himself, but it finally brings the MotoGP series back to the top of its game.
Valentino Rossi: The Game is the largest chapter of the MotoGP series, with plenty of content and a revamped career mode. The good work done by Milestone is undermined only by the dated graphics.
Valentino Rossi: The Game is the official MotoGP videogame for 2016, with tons of content and features, and good gameplay.
The different disciplines added as a tribute to Valentino Rossi are enough to fill the content of a video game that as MotoGP 16 would have been more of the same.

Valentino Rossi The Game needs more care for aesthetic, the driving system is not perfect and still suffers from some physical inaccuracies. However, the game has accomplished a big result: it is not a plain racing game, it's a game about passion for racing.
As MotoGP 16, there are no playable or visual changes compared to previous years, but, as a tribute to Valentino Rossi and the last twenty years of the World Championship, this game is worth it.

Even though some of its gameplay elements don’t really work (like, for example, the driving sessions) Valentino Rossi: The Game if full of Milestone’s “know how” of the genre and offers a complete motorcycle riding experience.
Valentino Rossi: The Game is a solid entry in the long running MotoGP series made all the better for the inclusion of the Valentino Rossi inspired, Legacy Mode.

Valentino Rossi: The Game is a good racing game, it feels good to drive and the physics works pretty well. Fans of Valentino Rossi might find more enjoyment in the game than the more casual players, though.

As a racing experience, though, this was generic. Obviously, mileage will most certainly vary depending on how big a fan one is of the world of MotoGP. At best, for fans of Rossi himself, this is at least a rental.

Valentino Rossi The Game is a tribute to the Italian motorbike pilot, glued with the yearly MotoGP game. With few improvements over the past ones, this game will mostly appeal to VR42 fans, and Moto GP fans.
Valentino Rossi: The Game knows everything there is to know about the man behind the number 46. I just wish it knew a little bit more about crafting an exciting MotoGP game.
good game, good motorbike feeling, better then MGP15. if you like moto GP you should buy this game, if you like normal motorbike thinks, not sport - the Ride will be better.

Iwas looking for a game that included the history of MotoGP, and this game nailed it. You can play 20 years of history with a huge roster of bikes and, generally speaking, I really enjoyed the game. Of course this is focused on Rossi s career, but the game is huge and it could entertain those who are not very fan of the Italian rider.

Milestone have done a great job making this game. It definitely feels like a day in the life of Valentino Rossi. Also I like how they brought some old tracks back like Phakisa and my favourite, Laguna Seca.

Valentino Rossi the Game è quel tipo di gioco che non smette mai di stupire e non parlo da tifoso del grande campione romagnolo. Il gioco è vasto, completo, divertente e tecnicamente ben realizzato. Per non sembrare troppo partigiano ho cercato qualche pecca e le uniche che ho trovato sono così minuscole da essere veramente ininfluenti. Sicuramente il modello di guida delle quattro ruote non è al topo, ma considerate che si tratta di un gioco dedicato alle due ruote, dove la guida automobilistica serve solo a spezzare un po’ il ritmo. L’altra cosa che ho trovato sotto tono rispetto alla complessiva struttura del gioco, sono le corse Fast Track sull’ovale, che non sono al top per quel che riguarda il sistema di guida. Per il resto tutto è all’altezza della fama di Valentino Rossi: ci sono centinaia di schede sulla sua vita su due ruote, una modalità Carriera divertente ed appassionante, la possibilità di sfidare Valentino sui suoi tempi oppure quella di gareggiare nelle sue corse storiche. In questo gioco Milestone ha unito alla perfezione la sua ultradecennale esperienza nelle simulazioni di moto con l’omaggio ad un Grande (con la G maiuscola) come il nostro VR46

Career mode is really nice: you can create and customize your rider and then join a Moto3 team, making your way to the MotoGP championship. Between the main races the game makes you ride a flat track bike and a rally car, and any race increaces your rider's ability. You will need a lot of hours to complete your career (at least 4 seasons + extra events), therefore the lasting appeal of this game is really good.

Although there have been quite the improvements on graphics and gameplay, there is not much improvement on the AI area, they are still very easy to beat on the highest level, i sometimes have a 2 second + lead in qualifying if i really try my best, can't say its that great although the different gameplay does make it more interesting

Don't get fooled by the title: this is NOT a game about Valentino Rossi only. It's a complete game, with all the MotoGP 2016 and 2015 championships, Moto2, Moto3, historical bikes, flat track and much more. While I didn't like the rally mode (I'm not a big fan of cars) the amount of contents is impressive. One of the biggest motorbike games ever made.

The game is a big step forward in comparison to MotoGP 15 and earlier years. It has dirt bikes, rally, racing and drifting. Online is not great (as always with a Milestone title) but single player is tons of fun. I especially like the historical events which you can play.

Legendary Valentino Rossi gets his own game... and it's pretty good! This is clearly a game of the MotoGP series that takes the name of Valentino Rossi and puts it on the cover, but the game includes a lot of new features. I was very surprised to see that the put even Monza Rally in the game. Even if this is mainly a MotoGP game, the new stuff they’ve put in it is fun to play!

this game has a graphic of at least 10 years ago . It is not fun and the bike seems to fly on the slopes, there seems to be contact between the wheels and the track . In addition , the AI ​​of opponents appears to be that of Mario Kart , with all due respect to Mario Kart . 70/80 game that give him ten years ago was already so . Today one is the most that you can give to a game based only on rider name. Please stay away , after 3 games will regret having bought it . I still have to understand why we users had to pay taxes on this game as the main character did not pay.

A great evolution to the Motogp series, this time with tyhe inclusion of all those little things outside the races, makes you feel investe3d in the world of your rider, all te customization options are great and the bikes handle and sound way better than in other entries of the series, eveithing under the name of our most charismatic rider VR46

Between the main races the game makes you ride a flat track bike and and a rally car, and any race increases your rider's ability. You will need a lot of hours to complete your career (at least 4 seasons + extra events), therefore the lasting appeal of this game is really good.

On the whole t is a good game. Graphics best so far in MotoGp games. Sadly it's not treu to life, with old lay-out in spain and accept for Ducati, absence of winglets. Contacted Milestone an d never got a reply, wich is a shame...

title: Valiant Hearts: The Great War
summary: The story of crossed destinies and a broken love in a world torn apart. All of them will try to survive the horror of the trenches following their faithful canine companion. In Valiant Hearts: The Great War, the lives of all these characters are inextricably drawn together over the course of the game. Friendship, love, sacrifice, and tragedy befall each one as they help each other to retain their humanity against the horrors of war.
reviews: In a way Valiant Hearts is a challenge to everyone in the industry; it's a challenge to the publishers churning out the same old "war games," and it's a challenge to all the players that continue to buy into these games without really thinking about what they are playing. War isn't fun, and it has a real impact on the people that are involved in it. It's games like this one that, critically, remind us that there is a human side to war.

This game made me shed more tears than any game I have ever played before, and I find that I am not alone in that sentiment. I even think this game communicated parts of WWI so well that it could be used as an educational tool, though the characters’ story is fiction.

It offers an appreciation of the smaller struggles during The Great War while exposing its horrors. The characters are charming, the gameplay is interesting, the storyline is gripping, and the visuals are full of heart.
Compelling and respectful in a way few games can match. [Aug 2014, p.90]

Overall, I couldn’t have been more pleased with Valiant Hearts: The Great War. Beautiful art, moving music and a compelling story that has a heart wrenching and unexpected ending with plenty of subtext for you to chew on, it was an absolute treat to play.

Valiant Hearts: The Great War delivers a moving story that will surely leave an impression on you. The UbiART engine delivers another great artistic showpiece telling a story through animation, a powerful and harrowing musical score and documentary-like narration. Valiant Hearts doesn't depict what war may have been like, it makes you feel it.

Valiant Hearts is quite a peculiar title: behind a simple (and even questionable) videogame lies a stunning experience than will warm your heart while teaching you actual history. If everyone played it, the world would surely become a better place.
Valiant Hearts: The Great War is a poignant and powerful reminder of the significant human toll borne of the wars that we so often act out in our favourite video games.

Valiant Hearts is a masterpiece, a game that combines gameplay and narration so well that it should be an example for every game designer. And it can teach you a thing or two about the Great War and the human nature. You should really play this game.

Valiant Hearts tackles the harsh realities of what this war did to regular families. It tore people apart and, conversely, brought strangers closer together. It’s a beautiful tale of love and woe, with a consideration for the chilling realism of war.

Ubisoft did it again. After Child of Light there is again a unique downloadable game. Valiant Hearts: The Great War is a compelling puzzle game, a must have. It has a funny look but it's actually a game with many layers.

So in the end, Valiant Hearts is something of a flawed masterpiece. But it’s a masterpiece nonetheless. This is a game that definitely won’t be for everyone, but it’s something that the videogame industry has been in dire of need of.

Valiant Hearts: The Great War is one of the best graphical adventures you can find nowadays. Its beautiful visuals provided by UbiArt engine was already known as a good choice, so the surprise comes with the amazing story it manages to unfold.

While it can be completed in less than six hours, it perfectly explores themes and concepts that triple-A titles still have difficulty grasping: gray morality, a poignant, thought-provoking storyline, and appealing gameplay that isn't based on killing everything in sight.

Valiant Hearts: The Great War is a history lesson as you have not experienced it, ever. The story is full of touching moments, small pieces of joy and at the same time it shows the horrific impacts of war. The gameplay remains varied, although the puzzles are a bit repetitive.

Valiant Hearts’s low barrier of entry difficulty-wise makes it a perfect gateway game for those who don’t usually enjoy the genre. While the puzzles are simplistic, they’re also fun to solve and never get in the way of the interesting storyline going on.

A very unique experience, which mixes delicate graphics to the gritty storytelling of the worst war the world has come to know. When it tries to be anything less than tragic, it might lack some of that energy, but it's still a game anyone should at least give a try.

Valiant Hearts: The Great War is inspired by letters written during the Great War and has four characters on the battlefield. They sneak across enemy lines and solve puzzles to fight for their survival. The artwork looks amazing and is complemented by the game’s soundtrack.

After Child of Light, Valiant Hearts is another great game from Ubisoft on the UbiART Framework engine. And it proves the publisher can make something great, even with a tiny budget. Even with its WWI background, Valiant Hearts isn't just an historic documentary: it's really a story-driven title, which focuses on characters and successfully displays quite classic gameplay.
Hearts has been a total surprise, first for its historic fidelity and then for its gorgeous comic visuals. A master class not to be missed.

Behind the cartoonish visuals, there's a great game that deals with a conflict as deep as the World War. A beautiful experience on every front, we think it would have been released as a full retail game if launched a few years ago.
Never syrupy, sensationalized, or cliched, but dulled by puzzles that veer between easy and illogical. [Sept 2014, p.72]

The heartbreaking First World War is a perfect setting for games and as expected with Valiant Hearts, Ubisoft delivers a beautiful, intimate tearjerker. It certainly does not excel in terms of gameplay, but this is compensated, by strong, impressive artwork. The world is so attractive that they could have skipped the puzzles to make an animated film instead.
Ubisoft Montpellier's take on the first World War is a surprisingly heartfelt adventure.

In any case Valiant Hearts does something genuinely different, and it does so well. There has been a large contingency of people asking for a war game in which you don’t pick up and fire a gun, so it’s great that, when it actually happened, we were given a game with this much charm and emotion packed into it.

Valiant Hearts could very well be the most poignant World War I game ever made, especially as it tells a tale from both sides of the conflict without getting bogged down in the unnecessarily stupid allegiances and battles that wasted thousands of precious lives.

It is not perfect; it is far, very far from the intentions of other IPs like Medal of Honor. And, the most significant thing: It's a war game without shooting mechanics. Valiant Hearts: The Great War not only tells us the story of the First World War, that one that seems not to be very interesting looking all the games based on WWII, but it tells it with a visual sense of pure art, the only one that the UbiArt engine achieves. It is about soldiers and battles, about lost and death, but also about things the new generations should know, because it is our story after all. Visual novel concepts mix with the core of the graphic adventure, and the result needs some adjustment and balance here and there, but it is one of those experiences that can touch us.
Its gameplay is too linear and basic but from the plot to the art design is a marvelous project.

It's a valiant little game, then. One you won't begrudge for its final monologue about honor, homeland, and freedom -- words that usually have my eyes rolling whenever lesser games dare to utter them.
While Ubisoft has shown that it can deliver outstanding blockbuster AAA titles, its growing library of creative downloadable games should put EA and Activision on notice: this is how to be creative.

There’s not much of a challenge or a reason to revisit once you’ve finished, but the story alone is worth experiencing. Ultimately, it’s a game about warfare that’s more interested in the people and their experiences, than bullets and their targets.

Valiant Hearts is a good game offering an emotionally satisfying experience. With about six hours of gameplay (depending on puzzling speed) it has solid value. As humans, we should all play this, even though it's not the best gaming has to offer.

Valiant Hearts: The Great War can be poignant and contemplative, but it does undermine itself by including a cartoonish villain. Superb art direction and a genuine interest in its own subject matter count in the favour of a game that is unremarkable in a mechanical sense.

A rare gem that takes the time to commemorate a tragedy, exploring its human cost in a way that's both meaningful and moving, and relying upon core interactions that are mostly about helping others rather than harming them. [Sept 2014, p.114]
A surprisingly sensitive, if flawed, retelling of a harrowing time in human history.

Its narrative is able to offer a story that manages to be humorous and even lovely during one of the darkest periods of humanity, but there are hardly any serious obstacles and it leaves no desire to play a second time.

Valiant Hearts doesn't make the most of what it's got: the four playable protagonists (the dog is essentially a tool for fetching things) each offer different perspectives on the war, but their stories are predictable and too dependent on coincidence to really engage...No matter. Valiant Hearts may be confused, but it's also brave.

This game could be considered as a good one in terms of gameplay. But the whole package is a very intense, very moving experience. Thanks to its graphics, its story, its characters and the clever way it talks about a very sad part of History, Valiant Hearts can be considered as one of the best initiatives this year. With games of this kind, with a soul, even not perfect, we ask for more.
A heavy-handed but impressively sincere attempt to tackle a subject most other games would never dare, with the end resulting being both affecting and entertaining.
It may not be challenging or action-packed, but Valiant Hearts provides some thoughtful and sobering looks at what life was like on the front.
Very pretty, but pretty shallow. Unchallenging – both emotionally and as a puzzle-platformer. [September 2014, p71]

This game feels like a well intended failure. Its puzzles are too simple and easy to solve, the action parts are diluted minigames and the animations feel cheap. However, the historical context is interesting and the visual style is amazing. In the end, sadly, Valiant Hearts is unable to overcome its weaknesses.

There’s good puzzling to be had, and some engaging stories here, but a lean towards either fictional fun or serious stories would have worked better. And while this was an interesting experiment, we //really// don’t want to see a WWII game presented the same way.
A short and simple adventure game with strong atmosphere delivered via an unique visual style. If you're looking for something different, this is it. [Issue#244]
And yet, even in its current state, you still have a game that aims to be more than just a jingoistic, us-versus-them shooter, and Valiant Hearts comes off as a blessed gasp of fresh air as a result.
Valiant Hearts is a correct game, but also a superficial tribute that lacks some boldness and will to adopt fresh gameplay solutions.

Valiant Hearts is a really ambitious war game that has the most of the ingredients that have been missing in the genre so far. Most of the characters is really enjoyable and the graphics is fantastic. Unfortunately the mechanics are too basic and the story isn’t very well written.

As a means to tell stories based on actual events Valiant Hearts: The Great War works fairly well. The plot is engaging, the characters compelling and the use of World War One as a backdrop is a bold, but ultimately good decision by Ubisoft Montpellier. The beautiful, hand drawn graphics are stunning to look at, and manage to underscore how difficult life in the trenches was. Unfortunately Valiant Hearts isn't able to justify itself as a game. The gameplay is, ultimately, not very interesting and completely without challenge.

Unbelievable.  Emotional, moving, intimate.  Beautiful.  This is what is taking gaming from a child's activity to the most powerful medium available for storytelling. Simple story based on a truly horrific event.  Easy to identify with, lovable characters, and an interface so friendly this is accessible to gamers of all skill level.

Valiant Hearts is a 2-D side scroller that incorporates gameplay in the fashion of puzzle solving to progress through a very well told story set in World War I. The story is told in comic book style with no animations for their cutscenes. The narration is very well done, and the music selection with contemporary pieces is beautiful. It took me about four hours to play, however, that took about a week's worth to get through as I found myself only playing in 15 to 30 minutes spurts. Perhaps because the mind can only go for so long solving puzzles before it needs to move on to something else. The developers did try to interrupt these puzzles with different type of game mechanics, such as those found in classic arcades like "Space Invaders" and "Dig Dug", as well as newer game mechanics like "Angry Birds" and "Guitar Hero". However, I think these mechanics didn't work very well in this game as they did in those games that I mentioned above. If you don't like history or education, you may not appreciate all the items you find to unlock the history of World War I and the reading that goes along with them; which I actually loved. It gave me a good sense of understanding World War I's history much better and the people who lived and fought during that time. It made me care about these characters in the story. Excellent overall story presentation and puzzle solving, however this game may not be to some likings as it game length and reading requirment.

Despite my burning distaste for Ubisoft, I quite enjoyed this game.  I'm echoing the herd at this point, but it was simplistically delivered, and emotionally touching.  It manages to humanize rather than villainize soldiers in the unique setting of WWI.  This is definitely not for the twitchy types or adrenaline junkies, it's slow paced and easy going, but in the end it hits you right in the feels.

This is probably one of the best puzzle adventures ever made. It's beautiful and touching with a lot of interesting facts that help you immerse in the story (and learn something along the way) . Well made in every aspect.

Valiant Hearts is a 2D sidescrolling puzzle game that tells a great story during the events of WWI. While its not an action game which one might expect for a game set in a war but it does get a nice balance and pace for the gameplay and story.
Valiant Hearts: The Great War was a great game that had some high emotional moments throughout, this is was a free pick up on PS Plus and it was worth it.

Good plot, great storytelling, but poor gameplay. This is a simple puzzle game that exploits greatly an historical setting to build up a solid novel. I think of it as a nice interactive movie instead as a boring adventure videogame.

I loved this game. The puzzles were entertaining. The world beautifully designed. It had enough background information to keep you informed if you so choose. It didnt pop up in your face breaking the pace of the game. I also admired how they included all aspects of the war, and covered all the groups involved. Well done for being culturally inclusive and truthful.

The game's story is touching and beautiful, but I have a problem with the gameplay. The gameplay is very boring even for a 2D game. All you need to do is go from place A to B. Sometimes you have to search stuff in the world and go back and forth, back and forth with ultimately slow speed, since the characters move quite slow. And the constant mumbling of a certain character was incredibly annoying over time.
If your looking for a deep puzzler, or a robust platform game, this isn't it.

Overall 6/10. Music was the best aspect of this extremely linear, short-lived, novel. Too much reading, consisting of the 100+ collectible items, historical facts, and journal entries. The ending was great, but the overall performance of this OK game was just that: OK. Walking from point A to B to C etc. while button mashing the X button to hopefully find any hidden collectible. Button mashing by the dog and you per the dog, every 1 to 2 seconds. I will never play again, and I hope Ubi actually makes better games from now on, than this and ASSASSin's Creed
Beautiful style and beautiful story. The narration in this game is fantastic. Great to see Ubisoft recognising the popularity of indie games and giving the time and funding to a project such as this.

This game has an excellent, really moving, captivating story. The setting, music, graphics etc. are great. Game play wise, it is a bit like the old point and click adventures but a lot simpler, which is not necessarily bad. I also loved all the real historical data, why not learning a bit while playing? Not only that, reading those historical facts and the horrors of the war made me experience the story in a much more intense way (emotionally speaking). Like a good story and point and click adventures (much simpler that the old ones)? Give this one a try.

Valiant Hearts is a beautiful game that shows you what few other war games ever will: War is not fun. There  very little besides pain and despair for those involved. This portrays this wonderfully, but still manages to wrap all of it around a very touching story.

Moving and intimate.  These are just two words to describe this game. Ubisoft have shown the true horrors of war with grace and truthfulness, yet with respect. All should play this game just to get an idea of what it would been like for all those brave men and woman.
Отличная игра, повествует о событиях Первой мировой от лица простых французских солдат.

This is something hands down amazing. Valiant Hearts goes deep in that of WW1 a very touchy subject as neither side could be described as good or evil like many can with WW2, so instead the game goes into the lives of soldiers and show/tells us the ways how war is Hell. We got 4 characters here Emile a French Soldiers, Freddie a US citizen joining French forces, Anna a medic who only aims to make sure people survive this Hell, and Karl Emile's step son who was forced out of France and made into a German Soldier. However Emile in this is the main main character, the game mostly centers around each one of these character's personal goals and endeavors making the war something of an obstacle for each of them to get around. Gameplay wise is it is a simple 2D platforming/puzzle solving adventure usually you have to progress past something by finding an item to use to progress past something, simply put if you don't like being paced and stopping to think stay away from this game. Even with that said it's something to see with the ending being pure beauty (not going to spoil anything) as we drag our character witnessing horrifying (yet stylish) cartoonish locations that make it so when the heavy emotional stuff has a greater impact than any serious war game that has come up in the past. With all this considered there is a certain demographic that is specifically targeted here and that is people interested in story, if you don't have a lot of time on your hands, or are looking for game to have actual fun in then I have to tell you to stay far away from this game as possible, it has a heavy atmosphere that doesn't let up putting the weight war on your character who you can't help but want to come out of this, this game is also very educational too somethings are simple and in fact you could learn some new things which is pretty neat. But anyway this is a very emotional pain train of a game and will play with your emotions like nothing. I would give this game a score between 8-9 but I decide to give this a 10 to somewhat raise the score a bit.

Finally there is a war game which is not to gun blaze every one all the time. Valiant Hearts: The Great War has a interesting, touching and meaningful story line. Gameplay is quite good. The puzzle solving is great. It even creates more intense moment than other ordinary action adventure game. It is probably the best game Ubisoft has made this year. It is very cheap and you should pick it up. 1 marks extra is given to all the emotional and beautiful trailers of this game.

Unbelieveable game! Took my breath away. This Ubisoft took history and video games, a told an amazing story about the hardships during World War 1 in Europe. The characters, the soundtrack, gameplay, etc., were all amazing. This game will really hit home for some people, so expect sadness at some points. Beautiful, beautiful game; that must be played for people with a heart. These indie games are really starting to make an impact in the industry of video games. A must play for only 15 bucks!

Amazing game which compelled me to write my first review, ubisoft are fast becoming my developers of choice. Love the art style it's beautiful and shows that current gen photo realism is not always best. pick this up you won't be disappointed. By the way ignore the 0 scores they are a joke, they must have been playing an atari 2600 game or something.

Valiant Hearts:The Great War is a game that both inspires and encourages hope in a bleak and desolate WW1 era Europe. The puzzles were fleshed together in a way that made sense both in game and in context, you aren't superman, you are a soldier. You need to use your mind to get through situations. Decisions need to be made in seconds if you wish too keep those you love alive. The game brings a incredible amount of emotion into a time that is tragically overlooked. It puts you in the position of normal, regular day people, made to fight in one of histories most atrocious wars. Death and sorrow become commonplace in the trenches of Valiant Hearts, and the fantastic sound and art design create a atmosphere which makes you feel so vulnerable, so out in the open, that it made me shiver any time I would see a fellow soldier fall to just one of thousands of hazards that plagued the battlefield. While experiencing the levels, you will find a dynamic backdrop that shows the plight of your brothers, those who are simply following orders. The "boss battles" if you will are excellent and well paced as they make you lose that sense of security of abiding by your own rules and throw you into situations filled with panic and paranoia. The fight with the Baron in the bunker stands out as incredibly tense and filled with emotions that compel you to prevail in order to save those you hold so dearly . The story complements the game play in a way that few games, excluding Journey and Brothers: A tale of Two Sons, have managed to accomplish. It creates a bond not between you and the characters, but the characters themselves. Never once while playing did I feel that  I was playing a game, I felt like I was there with the assortment of character that we encounter in this journey. The ending itself suits the game perfectly and not to spoil anything, it did leave a hole in my heart. All in all, this game is another fantastic example of the rebirth in story-driven games that has come to fruition in these past 2 years. If you have 15 dollars on hand, you owe it to yourself to get a copy of Valiant Hearts: The Great War.
This is one of the games that got me more sentimnetaly attached to it you should play it.I think this game is worth every penny spent on it and also i cried several tims trough the story.

Stunning visuals and incredible story, at no point was I left disappointed. A variety of gameplay mechanics make the game feel fresh and surprising from start to finish , If you're used to more difficult puzzles like in Machinarium then you might be disappointed, you won't have to search through a FAQ to get passed these puzzles but I don't think they are meant to stump you. The real reward is in the story and visuals the gameplay and puzzles compliment it. this is war told honestly and I hope its success leads to more emotional stories from the frontline and not more superhero type one man army games (Although I don't want to see all of those go either)

Valiant Hearts: The Great War is a very interesting concept for a game. A puzzle Adventure set in the midst of World War One. While there are parts of this game that do a good job and reminding us of the price the conflict had on everyone, it's too often sandwiched between an overly cartoonish representation of war, obtuse puzzle design, and action segments that would make even Call of Duty players scratch their heads at the lack of realism. I can only recommend this if you're a history buff or a fan of old adventure games.

Not for everyone, yet I felt this game was made just for me.  A story that gave so much emotion, which is rare.  Shadow of Colossus and The last of us are the only games I feel can compete with that.  Art is beautiful.  I despised history class, yet this game gives interesting facts that make you realize WW1 had more than death and treaties signed.  Great stuff. This is why I play video games. This game... right here. Forget the gore, violence and sex and all that other jazz that gets pumped into games. This game boils down to something pure and honorable. Something that connects with anyone who has a shred of compassion for a fellow human being. The musical score and characters and the terrible situation (WWI) they find themselves in draw you instantly. Then you stay, through the puzzles and the mud, anger and tears, because you want each character to be happy. But war isn't a happy place and the game reminds you of this. "War makes men mad". Straight up one of the best game I ever played. It looks amazing but more importantly the story is really good. It's emotional and gets you right in to the story and WW 1. I played this game thanks to the PS+ subscription but I'll be reviewing it like if i paid its full price as it is no longer free to download.

This puzzle adventure game has very simple puzzles, but suprisingly the characters and story kept me playing. The more I played, the more I leaned closer to the T.V not only because of the engaging story, but because of the fun/unique/intense/ and sometimes even wacky puzzles and action during the span of this game. I also loved the art-style of the game, the narration was very interesting, and the gameplay was very responsive. Having the collectibles also kept this game from being linear, which I enjoyed. from the start to the end, this game is beautiful. it works well at all at which is does, from the story, to the way the puzzles are implemented. i wont speak of anything specific of what i liked or disliked as i would recommend you see it all for yourself. its good game. a really game. a refreshing one. and im more than happy i bought it. i wouldnt say its perfect, but it has a sweet spot my heart!
One of the best games in it genre. Great graphics, great story. Once I started playing I couldn't stop!

Superb game, it keeps growing and growing on you, until the end, that is beautiful. The piano songs, art, camera movements, clever puzzles and a cast of very nice characters, that by the end of the game feels like they're your friends.
An incredible piece of art. Emotional gaming at its best. A bit on the easy side, but enjoyable overall. Ubisoft must give us a sequel. One of 2014's best.

This is one of those games that sticks in your mind and makes you care and interested. Also, the piano score in this game really helps to set the mood perfectly, the atmosphere is great. I didn't expect much, got it on PS+ for free, so I just tried it out and I was very positively surprised. I cried.  I really did. What a beautiful emotional game. Was not expecting to love it as much as I did.  I love a good indie game that really shocks you

Valiant Hearts is one of the finest games about war ever created. War games typically involve aiming down sights and shooting folks while everything blows up around you, a cut scene starts that tries to shoe horn in some story, then you follow another guy to another place, shooting along the way, for another cut scene. Valiant Hearts does away with all of that, telling the story of multiple characters whose lives intersect during World War I, and giving you glimpse into how devastating the Great War was.

This game is so unique, emotional, and beautiful, that it would be a crime for anyone to rate it low or not feel a thing when you're playing it. I mean it, who wouldn't feel a thing when it goes to the horrors of war, that war being World War 1, and the fact that it has a helpful dog companion?

Beautifully drawn and animated game, with a moving story and touching music! The gameplay is fun and simple, completing puzzles and thinking outside of the box without it being repetitive. The extra information you get about WWI is worth reading and adds to the atmosphere of the game. The thing that struck me most was that Valiant Hearts is a rare war-based game in which killing your enemies is NOT the main goal; instead you sneak your way through gas filled tunnels and ruins, avoiding dangers while trying to help the locals or sometimes even collaborate with the enemy. One of the endbosses (if you can call it that) is about healing, not murdering. This game shows you the other side of war through a very touching story, and for that it left a deep impression on me. I thoroughly enjoyed playing this game, even though it had some minor bugs and glitches. A real recommendation!!

I only got this game as it was free on PS Plus but I'm very glad it was. What a pleasant surprise this game is. This puzzles in the games aren't that hard but it has a good story and also doesn't seem to shy away from the brutality of WW1 despite being a cartoon. It includes lots of facts to read up on about WW1 if you are interested too. Some parts feel a little tedious but overall a really enjoyable game.

In a way Valiant Hearts is a challenge to everyone in the industry; it's a challenge to the publishers churning out the same old "war games," and it's a challenge to all the players that continue to buy into these games without really thinking about what they are playing. War isn't fun, and it has a real impact on the people that are involved in it. It's games like this one that, critically, remind us that there is a human side to war.

Praise be, a good Ubisoft game to come out in 2014. Honestly, if Ubisoft spent more time and resources on games such as this, the industry would be a better place. Valiant Hearts is a low budget game from a smaller subsidiary of Ubisoft, but what it achieves with that budget is what makes this game the bargain of the year regardless of the asking price. This adventure weaves intuitive story telling and an emotional roller coaster with an educational base. Seriously, if I was a history teacher I would just demand all my students complete this game while I put my feet up over a nice cup of mocha and an episode of Game of Thrones and let the A-grade essays pile up on my desk. Valiant Hearts provides a detailed description of many battles fought over the course of the First World War including items of importance to the soldiers, military hardware involved in the conflict as well as dates, locations and events of relevance to the war. My favorite aspect of this game however, is how it places several interesting characters in the actual events of WWI, discusses traumatizing and depressing subjects but somehow makes it a pleasure to play and even funny at times, aided by the comic style design and lack of speech during gameplay. All in all, if you're looking for a 5-8 hour adventure that pulls on your heart strings and fills you full of knowledge that you can show off to all your friends, I struggle to think of a more perfect package than Valiant Hearts. This is one you're not gonna want to miss.

title: Valkyria Chronicles Remastered
summary: The Principality of Gallia, a small neutral country between two superpower nations, suddenly faces invasion at the hands of the Empire. In the face of an overwhelming military power, the Gallian army has lost all hope. However, a ragtag volunteer militia has risen up against all odds to fight off the invading Imperial Army! Through various situations born of the extreme nature of war, this large-scale strategy RPG depicts themes such as living life to the fullest and the importance of human relationships. [Sega]
reviews: Valkyria Chronicles is, simply, one of the best tactical games you’ll ever play. It’s serious, but doesn’t take itself too seriously. It’s emotionally compelling while never losing sight of the fact it’s also a game. It’s a popular and well-regarded game that, for whatever reason, people simply don’t talk about it enough. Hopefully with this PlayStation 4 release that will change.

All things considered, Valkyria Chronicles Remastered is about as close to perfect as it gets, and deserves all the attention (hopefully) garnered by this release. It was a godly SRPG eight years ago, and the improvements, though limited, for this remaster make the already achieved perfection even better.

Valkyria Chronicles is a must-have for any tactical RPG fan,and even if you’re not a fan of the genre, the story is worth the purchase alone. Valkyria Chronicles is still one of the best tactical RPGs this century.
A lack of a total visual overall barely detracts from the fact that Valkyria Chronicles Remastered is a total bargain, and the definitive version of the best in strategy.

Although Valkyria Chronicles Remastered isn't the most fully featured rerelease, it's nonetheless an excellent way of experiencing a classic. Valkyria Chronicles is every bit as good as it was last generation and reminds us how desperately we want new entries in the series. If you haven't played through Squad 7's story yet, that's a mistake you should correct as soon as possible.
A compelling game that holds up to this very day and still provides one of the best strategy RPG experiences you’ll find. It’s the same game we all know and love, just prettier.

If you're a fan of turn-based strategy games and you haven't played Valkyria Chronicles, you need to remedy that. Valkyria Chronicles Remastered is a great starting point. Veterans should also consider starting up another fight to drink in Remastered's slick new visuals.

Valkyria Chronicles received a lot of acclaim during its PS3 debut, and its praises must be sung again in this remastered port. Whatever Sega decides to do with the franchise from here on remains unclear, but at least fans new and old can enjoy one of their finest efforts in the last generation, not to mention one of the single best RPGs period.

As far as remasters go, Valkyria Chronicles is well done and holds true to the game’s original vision with respect to elements like art style and presentation. For long-time fans looking for another go and newcomers alike, it’s still a wonderful experience from start to finish for a smart $30. Let’s just hope this isn’t the last we see of it.
Valyria Chronicles remaster is an excellent addition to the PS4 library.

The quality of the port and of the game itself make Valkyria Chronicles Remastered a must-play title for strategy fans who haven't cracked it yet. The proposition of a purchase might be a bit more fraught for vets who don't feel the need to revisit since there's no genuinely new content here, but there's no question that it's good to see this classic made available to new fans on a new console.
It’s bold take on the strategy genre and beautiful presentation lends itself to an experience worth revisiting or experiencing for the first time.

Ultimately, Valkyria Chronicles Remastered is a beautifully crafted and original tactical RPG. While this particular package is lacking in special features, it’s still a perfect opportunity to play a charming cult classic at a budget price.

While Valkyria Chronicles always had presence of a seminal classic, its latest remaster on PlayStation 4 sets it up for a wider embrace. This is the advantage of being favorably advanced or, at least, distant from genre contemporaries; no matter when or where Valkyria Chronicles is found, it can create personal definition on its own beautiful terms.

Valkyria Chronicles is a deeply satisfying game and one that I really only have a few minor gripes with. By the time the credits rolled I found myself completely wrapped up in a cast of like-able characters and excited to dig into the game’s New Game +. If, like me, you never gave Valkyria Chronicles a chance then there’s no better time to see what you’ve been missing out on.
Valkyria Chronicles Remastered polishes up one of the best strategy games in recent memory and brings it to a new console.
One of the most beloved games arrives to PlayStation 4 with more stable graphics and all the previous content. Do not miss it.

Valkyria Chronicles was, and still is, one of the best strategy RPGs ever made, and this accomplished and very welcome PS4 port does it the justice it deserves. From its beautiful and timeless visuals to its engaging and often epic battles, everything about the game feels like it has been made with love and care, ensuring every moment spent with it is to be treasured.

The biggest draw about the remastered version of Valkyria Chronicles is the upgrade to 1080p resolution. However, it was already gorgeous on the PS3 eight years ago thanks to the watercolor-inspired artwork and storybook interface. Valkyria Chronicles Remastered looks exactly how I remember it looking, which is a testament to its impressive art design.
A great remaster of a timeless classic RPG that must be experienced by anyone looking for a great combat system and memorable characters.
Great story and excellent game mechanics. [Aug 2016]
Valkyria Chronicles is a charming and deep JRPG; perhaps not so difficult, but very funny, with strong emotion and depth. The excellent cel shading frames a truly excellent game.
When it comes to franchises that are worth revisiting in a new console generation, Valkyria Chronicles Remastered stands as a sterling example of how to do things right.

Valkyria Chronicles lands on PlayStation 4 with the same determination that it had eight years ago. The game is still brilliant, thanks to its intense story and a solid gameplay. This current-gen version won't have a top-notch look, but includes some interesting DLCs.
A timeless and fresh anime epic with thrilling tactical battles.
Exciting story told through a staged development of very successful way for the strategy and action.
An esoteric mishmash of genres and with an art style that belies the more sombre elements of the storyline.

While the remastered could and should have addressed some of the issues of the original game instead of adding new ones, it nevertheless remains a masterpiece. Valkyria Chronicles still is one of the best and most addictive Japanese games of the previous generation.
Still as much of a tactical joy as you remember. Very much worth picking up (again).
